jam.sort
Class RingInputStream

java.lang.Object
  java.io.InputStream
      jam.sort.RingInputStream
public class RingInputStream
extends java.io.InputStream

This class takes a buffer and creates from it a InputStream. The buffers are not copied but referenced so you must make sure not to remove the buffer while this class has a reference to it. This class is not re-entrant (multi-thread ready) so that it can be fast, synchronize locks take time. Adapted from java.io.ByteInputstream difference are that you don't construct a new class each time and methods are not synchronized.

Author:
Ken Swartz

read

                int off,

Reads into an array of bytes.

Parameters:
b - the buffer into which the data is read
off - the start offset of the data
len - the maximum number of bytes read
Returns:
the actual number of bytes read; -1 is returned when the end of the stream is reached.
